intro: Kallstroemia ranunculiflora, commonly known as the western meadow beauty, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its delicate, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Kallstroemia ranunculiflora has small, palmate leaves and is often found in association with other wildflowers in its native environment.
